image.altText: a group of people standing in front of a house at night

props.synopsis: The family of Alice Springs man Gach Top have found him alive near an Aboriginal homeland a week after he was reported missing and days after the official search was called off.

title.children: Missing Alice Springs man found by family in 'miracle' after police called off search

image.altText: Seneca Martin close-up at Garma.

props.synopsis: Like their Yolŋu hosts on Gumatj country, the stories, dance and regalia of Navajo, Comanche, Kiowa Sioux, Pueblo and Lakota nations in North America are intertwined with the land and natural environment.

title.children: In the red sand, two ancient cultures collide

image.altText: An airplane on the runway

props.synopsis: Nexus says the route linking Broome and Kununurra in the Kimberley with the Northern Territory's capital has become "financially unsustainable".

title.children: Calls for flight route to be regulated after Nexus pulls out

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde wavy hair, red t-shirt, blurred greenery in the background, sun hitting back of her head

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of sexual violence in Australia, with experts warning there's been a steep increase in children presenting with harmful sexualised behaviours.

title.children: The NT has the nation's highest rate of sexual violence, and it's worsening

image.altText: A woman in a t-shirt stands in front of a quick-flowing river in the remote Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Scientists say one of the Northern Territory's most important water systems is experiencing "significant depletion".

title.children: NT's vast Cambrian Limestone Aquifer 'getting drier', research finds

image.altText: An old dark skinned man wearing a red headband frowns

props.synopsis: Warlpiri elder Ned Jampijinpa Hargraves joins growing calls for federal intervention into law and justice policies in the Northern Territory.

title.children: 'We've had enough': Warlpiri elder issues plea to prime minister

image.altText: A man looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Eighty years after World War II, some of Japan's last survivors are still pushing for an apology and recognition. But time is running out.

title.children: A witness to one of Japan's lesser-known WWII horrors has this final wish

image.altText: Penny Wong tariff press conference

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says that without the development of a path to a two-state solution, there is a risk there will be "no Palestine left to recognise". Follow live.

title.children: Wong warns of risk 'there will be no Palestine left to recognise'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Japan wins $10b bid to build Australia's new warships
Albanese speaks to head of Palestinian Authority
'Risk' no Palestine left to recognise if things carry on as they are: Wong

image.altText: Melbourne Demons coach Simon Goodwin with floodlights behind him.

props.synopsis: Four years after leading Melbourne to a drought-breaking AFL premiership, Simon Goodwin is axed as Demons coach as the team is set to miss the finals for a second straight season.

title.children: Melbourne legend 'absolutely shocked' as Demons sack coach Simon Goodwin

image.altText: Picture of stock market board with ASX sign at the top left corner.

props.synopsis: Stock markets are overcooked and operating dangerously close to the Sun, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Awash with cash, the investment world is feeding upon itself

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The local share market opens strongly higher, with all sectors gaining ground in early trade. Wall Street rallies with key indices up between 1.5 and 2 per cent. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australian stock market gains 1pc in broad rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: American Eagle shares soar on Trump's Sydney Sweeney endorsement
New car? Mitsubishi. New fleet of warships? Mitsubishi
Commonwealth Bank flags $130 million charge in results

image.altText: Kate May walks down a footpath with her small black dog.

props.synopsis: A new survey has revealed the prevalence of migraines is far worse in Australian women than experts previously estimated.

title.children: 'Not just a bad headache': Migraine hits millions of Australian women

image.altText: abbott

props.synopsis: Republican Governor Greg Abbott has ordered authorities to arrest the dozens of Texas Democrats who fled the state to successfully block a vote on a Republican plan to redraw the state's congressional districts.

title.children: Texas governor orders arrest of Democrats who fled Texas

image.altText: Two selfies of an older man with white hair, stubble and bulging fake eye.

props.synopsis: The work of artificial eye maker Jack McDonald is again in question after more people come forward complaining about the eyes he has made for them.

title.children: 'My wife was crying': More complaints against prosthetic eye maker

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jim Chalmers in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Inside Labor, two camps have formed around the government's productivity round table: those who doubt Anthony Albanese has the inclination to tackle contentious new policy and those who see a genuine opportunity to achieve something of substance.

title.children: Can Labor's round table land Chalmers a term-defining reform package?

image.altText: A brown chicken on a farm looking at the camera side on.

props.synopsis: The ATO challenges research and development tax offset claims made by prominent poultry producer Ingham's, with tens of millions of dollars involved.

title.children: Multi-million-dollar dispute pits major chicken brand against the tax office

image.altText: A man with a long beard poses for a photo while seated outside, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Chris Minns pledged to "declare war" on toll road administration fees, his government has yet to fulfil its promise to reduce the fees that toll road operators levy on drivers who fail to pay to use their roads.

title.children: 'Losing a lot of sleep': Motorists demand NSW toll road fee reform

image.altText: A man in traditional dress.

props.synopsis: Like their Yolŋu hosts on Gumatj country, the stories, dance and regalia of Navajo, Comanche, Kiowa Sioux, Pueblo and Lakota nations in North America are intertwined with the land and natural environment.

title.children: In the red sand, two ancient cultures collide

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands looking neutrally at each other with a man and woman sitting behind them

props.synopsis: The threat is the latest example of deteriorating relations between the US and India, with a trade deal still not struck despite months of negotiations.

title.children: Trump threatens India with further tariff hikes over Russian oil

image.altText: Tesla Powerwalls installed at a home.

props.synopsis: After surrendering its dominance of Australian electric vehicle sales, Tesla is also now also rapidly losing ground in the home battery market.

title.children: Tesla 'brand destruction' could cost it millions as battery sales boom

image.altText: A number of cans of energy drinks.

props.synopsis: As cases of blood toxicity from vitamin B6 continue to rise doctors raise concerns about the level of the product in food and especially energy drinks.

title.children: 'It's vitamin B6': Damage being caused by toxicity spreads to more products

image.altText: NSW police car parked in a residential street at night time

props.synopsis: Police say the two girls were known to each other, and homicide detectives are assisting with the investigation.

title.children: 14yo girl dead and 13yo arrested after stabbing in Newcastle

image.altText: Stephen Nutt stands in his police uniform, speaking in front of a sign that says AFP.

props.synopsis: A Chinese national has faced a Canberra court today after being arrested on Saturday and charged with foreign interference.

title.children: Chinese national charged under foreign interference laws

image.altText: A blue and black bus with the side lifted e to reveal a ladder and sleep pods inside

props.synopsis: After a flawed process that saw buses parked unused in depots for months, volunteers are pushing to launch independent sleep-bus services after the national charity Sleepbus folded last month.

title.children: Volunteers make sleep-bus dream come true after charity folds

image.altText: A group of people standing on steps look off camera.

props.synopsis: For Tasmanians wondering when they might have a parliament in place and some certainty about who will have the support to govern, it could still be weeks off. However, the official process is already underway.

title.children: Tasmania's election is over with no clear winner. This is what happens now

image.altText: A young Sudanese man with short curly hair.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old man who has been missing in the outback for a week has been found alive near Jay Creek outstation by residents of the Aboriginal homeland, close to where police discovered items of his clothing.

title.children: Missing man found alive a week after disappearance

image.altText: A man in a cricket uniform with one arm in a sling walks towards another man holding a cricket bat

props.synopsis: Chris Woakes comes out to bat with his dislocated shoulder in a sling, but England falls six runs short in a stunning finale to the five-Test series.

title.children: 'Career on the line': Woakes bats with arm in sling as England falls short

image.altText: A faint blue flame is burning from a gas element on a stainless steel cooktop

props.synopsis: The announcement by Solstice Energy will affect more than 1,000 customers, who will be forced to go electric or change to bottled gas.

title.children: Gas supply to 10 regional Victorian towns to be cut by end of 2026

image.altText: Hands holding six whole black truffles

props.synopsis: As Australia's truffle industry continues to grow, a truffiere on the New South Wales Central Tablelands has become the first in the country to be certified free of a banned chemical.

title.children: Hope for 'clean' truffle exports as producer axes banned chemical

image.altText: An aerial photo of Thurloo Downs National Parks following it's purchase by national parks.

props.synopsis: Visitors will be able to access a vast array of wetlands, woodland and waterholes across the 430,000-hectare site in far west NSW, which is home to dozens of threatened species.

title.children: Former outback sheep station set to open as national park next year

image.altText: A large battery storage system

props.synopsis: One of the most powerful energy storage batteries in the world has been designed to back up the grid in New South Wales.

title.children: Super battery capable of powering one million homes switched on

image.altText: graphic of a young girl's silhouette with the scales of justice

props.synopsis: According to Australian law, children are empowered to make their own decisions about the healthcare they receive — regardless of parental consent — so long as they fully understand what is being done.

title.children: Why the courts stepped in when a 12-year-old wanted an abortion

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media while standing on an airport runway in Pennsylvania.

props.synopsis: Comments by former Russian president Dmitry Medvedev led Donald Trump to announce he had repositioned two of the US's nuclear submarines.

title.children: Russia downplays Trump's nuclear submarine move, urges caution

image.altText: SHEIN

props.synopsis: Behind the TikTok hauls to Insta-ready aesthetic, a backlash is brewing, and Italy and France are leading the way.

title.children: Shein hype dominates social media, but in Europe the firm's accused of greenwashing

image.altText: Elon Musk wearing a black Make America Great Again cap and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The massive payout comes just six months after a judge ordered the company to revoke another mega pay package worth $86 billion.

title.children: Tesla awards its CEO Elon Musk $44b in shares
